environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Sangster J; LOGKOW Databank, A Databank of Evaluated Octanol-Water Partition Coefficients (LOG P) on Microcomputer Diskette, Montreal, Quebec, Canada: Sangster Res Lab (1994) (2) Meylan WM et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 18: 664-72 (1999) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 3.2 was calculated for ethylene cyanohydrin(SRC), using a log Kow of -0.94(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low.

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Sasaki S; pp. 283-98 in Aquatic Pollutants. Hutzinger O et al, eds. Oxford, UK: Pergamon Press (1978)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: AEROBIC: Ethylene cyanohydrin is confirmed to be biodegradable according to the standard test of the Japanese Ministry of Industry and Trade (MITI) that employs a mixed inoculum obtained from freshwater, soil, and sludge(1).

logP.References: Sangster J; LOGKOW Databank. Sangster Res. Lab., Montreal Quebec, Canada (1994)

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clayton, G.D., F.E. Clayton (eds.) Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology. Volumes 2A, 2B, 2C, 2D, 2E, 2F: Toxicology. 4th ed. New York, NY: John Wiley & Sons Inc., 1993-1994., p. 3147
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: Saturated vapor inhalation for 8 hr produced no effects /on rats/.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clayton, G.D., F.E. Clayton (eds.) Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology. Volumes 2A, 2B, 2C, 2D, 2E, 2F: Toxicology. 4th ed. New York, NY: John Wiley & Sons Inc., 1993-1994., p. 3147
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: Single applications to skin caused moderate local irritation but no toxicity up to 3.8 g/kg in the rabbit. In 15 repeated applications to rabbit skin, there was no injury.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Clayton, G.D., F.E. Clayton (eds.) Patty's Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology. Volumes 2A, 2B, 2C, 2D, 2E, 2F: Toxicology. 4th ed. New York, NY: John Wiley & Sons Inc., 1993-1994., p. 3148
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: .../It/ was applied to... skin (0.5 ml/guinea pig)... no effect was noted in 24 hr.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Patty, F. (ed.). Industrial Hygiene and Toxicology: Volume II: Toxicology. 2nd ed. New York: Interscience Publishers, 1963., p. 2026
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /IN THE RAT/.../ETHYLENE CYANOHYDRIN WAS/ FOUND NOT TO PRODUCE GROWTH EFFECTS...

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: HIROSE M ET AL; NAGOYA MED J 25(1-2) 1 (1980)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: MALE RATS & MICE WERE GIVEN 100 PPM IN THEIR DIET CONTINUOUSLY FOR 78 WK. BODY WT WERE LOWER IN TEST ANIMALS THAN CONTROLS, THEIR RED BLOOD CELL, WHITE BLOOD CELL, HEMOGLOBIN, & HEMATOCRIT LEVELS WERE ALSO LOWER THAN CONTROLS.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 23 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc for ethylene cyanohydrin can be estimated to be about 1(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that ethylene cyanohydrin is expected to have very high mobility in soil.
